Really what bloody different to the country does make if Harry and Meghan stay in the royal family or go join the Hare Krishna's. How about #r4today reports some real news, the HOC votes on child refugees or the #RussianReport would be a good start.

I love doing these deep dives on INCREDIBLE women who impacted how we live today. Dame Leah Manning gets her plaque this week for boosting access to school meals, birth control, and saving the lives of 4000 child refugees during the Spanish Civil War.

There are 5.6 billion people in the world according to the world bank who are poor. So poor in fact that they don't even have enough money to be refugees. "Refugees" & their I phones flood Europe, many having paid more than £20k to get here - a sum many here could not raise.

Latest from my beloved #Jakarta. 

337 mm of rain fell in one day, the most since records began in 1886. 

182 neighbourhoods under water, 185,000 #climate refugees & 63 dead.

The rainy season has a while to run, so it may get worse. 

More coal anyone?

Children need their parents, but unfair Home Office rules - harsher than those of our neighbouring countries - prevent refugee families from reuniting. If we all come together we can change this. #FamiliesTogetherpic.twitter.com/4aqv3dyQcX

Parliament has voted to scrap legislation enabling lone refugee children in Europe to be reunited with their families in the UK after Brexit.

I was recently diagnosed with cancer and what ever my fate is; I know I will have the best possible treatment b/c of public healthcare. But I wonder what happens to those who are in #refugee camps that get ill with cancer b/c their fate will be no better than those in the 1930s.

Do you work with refugees or asylum seekers? The @britishredcross are looking for social workers, carers, legal advisors, and anyone else that works with displaced people, to participate in research. If that's you and you have an hour to spare, send me a DM.
